intro: Pristiglottis occulta, commonly known as the hidden thread moss, is a small, cryptogamic plant belonging to the family Pristiglottidaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that form dense mats on the forest floor. It plays a crucial role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat. Due to its secretive nature and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
